text: The Lodi dynasty () was a dynasty that ruled the Delhi Sultanate from 1451 to 1526. It was the fifth and final dynasty of the Delhi Sultanate, and was founded by Bahlul Khan Lodi when he replaced the Timurid vassal of the Sayyid dynasty. The last ruler of the dynasty was the Sultan Ibrahim Lodi who died in the battlefield of Panipat. ==References== Category:History of Pakistan Category:Medieval history of Pakistan
title: Lodi dynasty
